ground_truth: She runs into the building; the taxi drives away. Evan, his back to the camera, walks to the front door and opens it to Hannah. Through a doorway, Norma can be seen sitting on a chair in the kitchen. She wears a robe over a slip and stockings; she's drinking. Evan stands in the doorway looking at her; he doesn't go in. Norma reacts, turning to her daughter. Hannah, however, has her back turned. She is busy taking charge in the kitchen as Evan speaks. She takes some pills out of a cupboard and hands them to her mother with a glass of water. The camera moves to Evan, who continues to tell his story, ignoring his wife's outburst, as he walks away from the kitchen doorway into the den. Evan walks over to the piano, where several framed family photographs sit in a line on its top. He picks one up as Norma speaks offscreen in the kitchen. The camera moves back to the kitchen as Norma talks. She is still glaring offscreen at the doorway where Evan stood moments before. She holds the water glass and the pills. Evan is back in the doorway, listening to Norma, getting more and more angry. As he makes a retort, he starts to walk back to the den and his piano. Hannah goes back to Norma; she takes the glass of water away. Hannah, choosing to ignore Evan's remark, hands her mother a cup of coffee; she puts her mother's hands on the cup. Norma sips her coffee, softly sobbing. Hannah, reacting, walks away from the counter and, capping the bottle of pills, puts them back in the cupboard. The camera moves in on Hannah's face as she reflects, her voice heard over the screen. The camera leaves Hannah's face as she continues to reflect; it moves to the den, to the row of family photos on the piano: one of a present-day Evan and Norma, others where both Norma and Evan are young, beautiful, hopeful. The film cuts back to the kitchen. Norma stands up; Hannah takes her coffee cup and sets it on the counter. She puts her arm around Hannah's shoulder. Mother and daughter walk out of the kitchen. Norma chuckles. They stop at the entrance to the den. Evan can be seen playing the piano as they continue their conversation. Norma chortles. Hannah laughs, touching her mother. They walk over to Evan at the piano. Norma leans over the piano; Hannah looks off into the distance, deep in reflection. The piano music continues in the background as the movie cuts to Lee walking along a wharf by the waterfront. The wind blows her hair; she hugs the Edward Estlin Cummings book to her chest.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
She hurriedly rushes into the building as the taxi that brought her there gradually fades into the distance, driving away. With his back turned to the camera, Evan approaches the front door, opening it graciously for Hannah to enter. As the camera pans through a doorway, Norma is visible, seated in a chair within the cozy confines of the kitchen. She is comfortably dressed in a robe layered over a slip and stockings, all while indulging in a drink. Evan stands in the open doorway, giving her a long, considering look without stepping inside. Norma, sensing his presence, reacts by turning her attention to her daughter, Hannah. However, Hannah's focus is elsewhere, with her back turned to her mother as she busily takes charge of the kitchen activities, while Evan speaks. Hannah reaches up to a cupboard, pulling out some pills, and hands them to her mother, accompanied by a glass of water. 

The camera smoothly transitions back to Evan, who is absorbed in telling his story, seemingly unaffected by his wife's emotional outburst. His voice carries through as he makes his way away from the kitchen doorway and into the den. There, Evan approaches the piano, where an array of framed family photographs is neatly arranged in a line on its polished top. He picks up one of the photos as Norma's voice continues to be heard offscreen from the kitchen. 

The scene shifts back to the kitchen, where Norma remains, glaring in the direction of the doorway where Evan had been standing just moments earlier. She grips the glass of water and the pills, seething with restrained emotion. Evan has returned to the doorway, listening to Norma with growing frustration. As he makes a sharp retort, he begins his return journey to the den and the familiar comfort of his piano. 

Meanwhile, Hannah attends once more to Norma. She takes the glass of water from her mother, opting to overlook Evan's pointed remark. Hannah hands her mother a warm cup of coffee instead, gently guiding her mother's hands to the cup. Norma takes a sip of the coffee and begins to softly sob. In reaction, Hannah moves away from the counter, carefully puts the cap back on the bottle of pills, and returns them to their place in the cupboard. 

The camera draws in closer to capture Hannah's face, deep in thought, her inner reflections audible over the screen. As she continues to reflect, the camera shifts its focus, moving away from Hannah's contemplative expression to the den. It captures the row of cherished family photos perched atop the piano: one of Evan and Norma in the present day, alongside others depicting a time when both were young, filled with beauty and hope. 

The scene transitions back to the kitchen, where Norma rises to her feet. Hannah takes her mother's coffee cup, setting it gently upon the counter. Putting a comforting arm around Hannah's shoulder, Norma begins to walk with her daughter out of the kitchen. Norma lets out a chuckle, and they pause at the entrance to the den. Inside, Evan can be seen playing the piano, and the two women continue their conversation. Shared laughter fills the space; Hannah playfully touches her mother. Together, they walk over to Evan at the piano. Norma leans forward over the piano, while Hannah gazes out into the distance, immersed in deep reflection. The soft strains of the piano music play on in the background as the film transitions to a new scene, cutting to Lee, who is seen walking along a wharf by the picturesque waterfront. The wind gently tousles her hair, and she hugs a cherished book by Edward Estlin Cummings close to her chest.

Norma takes a sip, her demeanor softening as she begins to sob quietly. Observing this, Hannah departs from the counter, securing the lid on the pill bottle, and returns it to the cupboard. The camera closes in on Hannah's introspective face, capturing her deep contemplation as her voice narrates over the scene. As Hannah's reflection continues, the camera pans to the den, highlighting the array of family photographs atop the piano: one of the present-day Evan and Norma, others capturing their youthful, hopeful selves. The film transitions back to the kitchen where Norma rises from her seat, prompting Hannah to take the coffee cup from her hands and set it gently on the counter. Norma's chuckle transforms into a more spirited chortle, prompting Hannah to laugh as well, tenderly touching her mother in solidarity. The pair approaches Evan at the piano, and Norma leans over it while Hannah gazes thoughtfully into the distance, lost in reflection. The gentle melody from the piano creates a soothing backdrop as the movie transitions to Lee, who is depicted walking along a wharf by the waterfront. The breeze tousles her hair, and she cradles an Edward Estlin Cummings book against her chest for comfort.

Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. she puts her mother's hands on the cup. Norma sips her coffee softly sobbing. Hannah reacting walks away from the counter and capping the bottle of pills puts them back in the cupboard. The camera moves in on Hannah's face as she reflects her voice heard over the screen. The camera leaves Hannah's face as she continues to reflect. it moves to the den to the row of family photos on the piano. one of a presentday Evan and Norma others where both Norma and Evan are young beautiful hopeful. The film cuts back to the kitchen. Norma stands up. Hannah takes her coffee cup and sets it on the counter. She puts her arm around Hannah's shoulder. Mother and daughter walk out of the kitchen. Norma chuckles. They stop at the entrance to the den. Evan can be seen playing the piano as they continue their conversation. Norma chortles. Hannah laughs touching her mother. They walk over to Evan at the piano. Norma leans over the piano. Hannah looks off into the distance deep in reflection. The piano music continues in the background as the movie cuts to Lee walking along a wharf by the waterfront. The wind blows her hair. she hugs the Edward Estlin Cummings book to her chest.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: She runs into the building. the taxi drives away. Evan his back to the camera walks to the front door and opens it to Hannah. Through a doorway Norma can be seen sitting on a chair in the kitchen. She wears a robe over a slip and stockings. she is drinking. Evan stands in the doorway looking at her. he does not go in. Norma reacts turning to her daughter. Hannah however has her back turned. She is busy taking charge in the kitchen as Evan speaks. She takes some pills out of a cupboard and hands them to her mother with a glass of water. Norma chuckles. They stop at the entrance to the den. Evan can be seen playing the piano as they continue their conversation. Norma chortles. Hannah laughs touching her mother. They walk over to Evan at the piano. Norma leans over the piano. Hannah looks off into the distance deep in reflection. The piano music continues in the background as the movie cuts to Lee walking along a wharf by the waterfront. The wind blows her hair. she hugs the Edward Estlin Cummings book to her chest.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She hops into the warehouse; the bicycle rolls away. Leo, his back to the forest, skips to the wooden gate and pushes it for Valerie. Through a window, Sherry can be seen reclining on a sofa in the parlor. She wears a jacket over a dress and boots; she's sketching. Leo lingers in the hallway staring at her; he doesn't enter. Sherry reacts, glancing at her neighbor. Valerie, however, has her back turned. She is busy organizing in the parlor as Leo sings. She pulls some candles out of a drawer and passes them to her friend with a mug of tea. The lens shifts to Leo, who continues to narrate his tale, disregarding his friend's remark, as he skips away from the parlor hallway into the library. Leo ambles over to the bookshelf, where several dusty ancient artifacts rest in a sequence on its shelf. He picks one up as Sherry murmurs offstage in the parlor. The lens shifts back to the parlor as Sherry murmurs. She is still glancing offstage at the hallway where Leo stood moments before. She holds the tea mug and the candles. Leo is back in the hallway, hearing Sherry, growing more and more irritated. As he mutters a comeback, he starts to skip back to the library and his bookshelf. Valerie returns to Sherry; she takes the mug of tea away. Valerie, opting to dismiss Leo's comment, gives her friend a bowl of soup; she places her friend's fingers on the bowl. Sherry sips her soup, quietly sniffling. Valerie, reacting, marches away from the table and, sealing the jar of candles, returns them to the drawer. The lens zooms in on Valerie's expression as she ponders, her thoughts heard above the scene. The lens shifts from Valerie's expression as she continues to ponder; it transitions to the library, to the row of ancient artifacts on the bookshelf: one of a current-day Leo and Sherry, others where both Sherry and Leo are young, graceful, dreaming. The reel shifts back to the parlor. Sherry rises; Valerie takes her soup bowl and places it on the table. She places her hand around Valerie's arm. Companion and neighbor stroll out of the parlor. Sherry giggles. They linger at the opening to the library. Leo can be observed strumming the bookshelf as they sustain their discourse. Sherry guffaws. Valerie chuckles, nudging her companion. They stroll over to Leo at the bookshelf. Sherry leans against the bookshelf; Valerie gazes into the horizon, immersed in contemplation. The bookshelf music continues in the distance as the film cuts to Pat strolling along a footpath by the park. The breeze rustles her scarf; she clutches the Jane Austen novel to her chest.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Hannah rushes into the building as the taxi departs. Evan greets her at the door, revealing Norma in a robe, drinking in the kitchen. Evan speaks while Hannah retrieves pills and water for her mother. Despite Norma's outbursts, Evan retreats to the den, examining family photos atop the piano. Norma's anger grows, prompting Evan's retort before he returns to the piano. Hannah takes the water from Norma, offering her coffee instead. Ignoring Evan's remark, Hannah reflects quietly. The movie shifts focus to photographs of Evan and Norma, capturing their younger, hopeful days. Back in the kitchen, Norma stands, and Hannah supports her, sharing a moment before they walk to the den. They find Evan playing the piano, and as they converse, Norma laughs. Hannah joins in, touching her mother's hand, as they stand by Evan. The piano music continues as the scene transitions to Lee, strolling along a breezy wharf, clutching an Edward Estlin Cummings book to her chest.
